meanings.definition: A deep cut or tear in the skin or flesh.
meanings.sent1: The doctor stitched up the laceration on the patient's arm.
meanings.sent2: She winced in pain as the laceration on her knee stung.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy chef's laceration on the tomato turned it into a modern art piece.
meanings.sent4: The laceration in their friendship was too deep to heal easily.
meanings.sent5: The jagged laceration on the tree trunk revealed its age and hardships.

meanings.definition: The act of tearing or cutting.
meanings.sent1: The loud laceration of the paper echoed in the room.
meanings.sent2: His swift laceration of the rope saved the falling box.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected laceration of the silence made everyone jump.
meanings.sent4: Her words were a sharp laceration to his pride.
meanings.sent5: The laceration of the fabric was deliberate, creating a unique design.
